item.title: <strong>为什么美国建房仍然如此昂贵</strong
item.description:
模块化住宅的问题。【原文：

The problem with modular housing.

】

item.title: 奇数地块：美国建房成本为何如此之高（播客）
item.description: 奇数地块：美国建房成本为何如此之高（播客）【原文：Odd Lots: Why It’s So Costly to Build Homes in America (Podcast)】

item.title: 贸易乐观情绪占据上风，国债全线下跌
item.description: 随着避险需求减弱，中美即将达成贸易协议的乐观情绪促使投资者抛售国债。【原文：Optimism the US and China are nearing a trade deal is prompting investors to sell Treasuries as demand for havens wanes.】

item.title: 历史性市场挤压缓解，白银租赁价格骤降
item.description: 伦敦的白银借贷成本已从历史高位回落，这表明市场的流动性已有所恢复，本月早些时候的挤压有所缓解。【原文：The cost of borrowing silver in London has retreated from a record high, a sign that greater liquidity has returned to the market and brought some relief from a squeeze earlier this month.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数落后于欧洲涨势，英镑保持稳定
沃达丰 Idea 的股价因印度最高法院允许重新审查应付款而上涨
item.description: 印度最高法院允许联邦政府重新考虑沃达丰集团（Vodafone Group Plc）旗下陷入困境的本地合资企业过去拖欠的数十亿美元债务，这点燃了这家亏损无线运营商的复兴希望。【原文：India’s top court allowed the federal government to reconsider billions in past dues owed by Vodafone Group Plc’s struggling local venture, stoking revival hopes for the loss-making wireless operator that has been weighed down by this lingering dispute.】

item.title: 贝森特在年底决策前提名美联储主席最终人选
item.description: 财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周一确认了美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）继任者的五位最终人选，总统表示他预计将在年底前做出决定。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on Monday confirmed the names of five finalists to succeed Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, with the president saying he expected to make his decision by year-end.】

item.title: 荷兰大选前，Nexperia 的风波加剧了企业的焦虑情绪
item.description: 荷兰选民本周投票时，结果很可能是议会四分五裂，没有一个政党接近多数。这将意味着漫长的联合讨价还价，使荷兰在一段时间内陷入看守政府的困境。【原文：When Dutch voters go to the polls this week, the outcome is likely to be a fractured parliament with no party close to a majority. That will mean lengthy coalition haggling, leaving the country stuck with a caretaker government for some time.】

item.title: 荷兰金融科技公司 Bunq 获准成为美国经纪商
item.description: 荷兰金融科技公司 Bunq BV 表示，它获得了美国监管机构颁发的经纪商执照，从而使这家在线银行能够在拓展国际业务的同时向客户提供证券交易服务。【原文：Dutch fintech Bunq BV said it received regulatory approval for a broker-dealer license in the US, allowing the online bank to offer securities trading to customers as it expands internationally.】

item.title: 比罗尔称，石油供应过剩将 "缓和 "近期上涨后的油价
item.description: 据国际能源机构称，由于供应充足，预计石油价格将 "趋缓"。【原文：Oil prices are expected to “moderate” because of ample supply, according to the International Energy Agency.】

item.title: 巴克莱银行在退出业务 11 年后重新进入沙特阿拉伯
item.description: 巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）正在重新进军沙特阿拉伯，成为在这个石油资源丰富、正在实施万亿美元经济转型计划的王国加强业务的最新一家银行。【原文：Barclays Plc is re-entering Saudi Arabia, becoming the latest bank to beef up operations in the oil-rich kingdom that’s in the midst of a trillion-dollar economic transformation plan.】

item.title: 印尼股市因担心 MSCI 权重变化而下跌
item.description: 在摩根士丹利资本国际公司（MSCI Inc.【原文：Indonesian stocks tumbled by their most in over six months after an MSCI Inc. consultation paper raised concerns about a potential re-weighting of local shares.】

item.title: 欧洲央行确定利率，欧元区将获得关税损害的确凿数据
item.description: 欧洲本周将接受严格的经济健康检查，在政策制定者召开会议确定利率之际，帮助衡量美国关税对经济增长和通货膨胀的影响。【原文：Europe will get a rigorous economic health-check this week, helping gauge the impact of US tariffs on growth and inflation as policymakers convene to set interest rates.】

item.title: 人工智能蓬勃发展刺激需求，欧洲科技行业表现出色
item.description: 欧洲科技企业盈利大幅超出预期，原因是对人工智能不断增长的投资拉动了需求，并抵消了贸易方面的不利因素。【原文：European tech earnings resoundingly beat expectations, as growing investment in artificial intelligence lifts demand and counters trade headwinds.】

item.title: 中国加强钢铁产能置换，螺纹钢价格上涨
item.description: 在中国宣布采取严厉的新产能限制措施以减少排放并解决全球最大市场长期供过于求的问题之后，螺纹钢期货走高。【原文：Steel rebar futures advanced after China announced tough new capacity restrictions to cut emissions and tackle chronic oversupply in the world’s biggest market.】

item.title: 尽管征收关税，泰国出口增长仍意外跃升 19
item.description: 泰国 9 月份的出口增幅为三年来最大，摆脱了美国总统唐纳德-特朗普征收关税的影响。【原文：Thailand’s exports rose the most in three years in September, shrugging off tariffs imposed by US President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 调查显示：尽管成本上升，美国企业仍普遍避免涨价
item.description: 全美商业经济协会的一项最新调查显示，许多美国公司计划在未来几个月内不提高价格，即使它们的成本在增加，利润率面临压力。【原文：Many US companies plan to resist boosting prices in the coming months, even as their costs mount and profit margins come under pressure, a new survey from the National Association for Business Economics showed.】

item.title: 美团寻求通过双币债券销售融资 30 亿美元
item.description: 美团计划融资约 30 亿美元，这将是该公司有史以来规模最大的一次定期债券发行，因为该公司面临着中国食品配送市场日益激烈的竞争。【原文：Meituan plans to raise around $3 billion in what would be its largest regular bond issuance ever, as the company faces intensifying competition in China’s food delivery market.】

item.title: 特朗普助推贸易协定乐观情绪，亚洲新兴资产攀升
item.description: 新兴亚洲股市跃升至四年多来的最高点，货币攀升，原因是与美国的贸易摩擦有缓解迹象，风险情绪有所改善。【原文：Emerging Asian stocks jumped to their highest in more than four years and currencies climbed as risk sentiment improved on signs of easing trade frictions with the US.】

item.title: 特朗普会晤前日本日经指数突破 50,000 点关键水平
item.description: 蓝筹股日经 225 指数首次突破 50,000 点这一心理关口，日本新首相对经济增长的乐观态度以及中美摩擦的缓解提振了投资者的情绪。【原文：The blue-chip Nikkei 225 Stock Average surpassed the psychologically key level of 50,000 for the first time as investor sentiment was boosted by growth optimism under Japan’s new prime minister and easing US-China frictions.】

item.title: 菲律宾央行行长认为随着贪污问题日益严重，将采取更多宽松措施
item.description: 一位官员表示，由于腐败丑闻对经济造成的影响可能会持续到2026年底，菲律宾央行可能会在12月再次下调关键利率，并在明年进一步下调。【原文：The Philippine central bank may cut its key interest rate again in December and further next year, as the economic fallout from a corruption scandal may linger through the end of 2026, an official said.】

item.title: 中国太阳能行业自律促使硅制造商扭亏为盈
item.description: 中国最大的太阳能电池板用多晶硅生产商发出信号，该行业在经历了过去几年的严重亏损后，已开始扭转颓势。【原文：China’s largest producers of polysilicon for solar panels have signaled a turnaround in the industry’s fortunes after steep losses over the past couple of years.】

item.title: 安瓦尔称特朗普会晤后芯片关税暂时不是问题
item.description: 马来西亚总理安瓦尔-易卜拉欣说，唐纳德-特朗普总统告诉他，美国和马来西亚将 "在适当的时候 "处理美国对半导体征收关税的问题。【原文：Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said President Donald Trump told him the US and Malaysia will deal with US tariffs on semiconductors “at the appropriate time.”】

item.title: 香港赛马会向加拿大公司出售价值 10 亿美元的投资组合
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，香港赛马会已将其基金组合中价值 10 亿美元的资产以折扣价出售给总部位于多伦多的 Dawson Partners 公司，这是亚洲资产配置机构最大的出售交易之一。【原文：The Hong Kong Jockey Club has sold $1 billion worth of assets from its fund portfolio at a discount to Toronto-based Dawson Partners, according to people familiar with the matter, marking one of the biggest disposals by an asset allocator in Asia.】

item.title: 分析师估算印度炼油商放弃俄罗斯石油的成本
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 中国人民银行摒弃谨慎基调，释放力挺人民币信号
item.description: 中国央行在推动扩大人民币在全球货币体系中的作用方面似乎采取了更加强硬的立场。【原文：China’s central bank appears to be taking a more assertive stance in its push to expand the yuan’s role in the global monetary system.】

item.title: 米莱大获全胜，阿根廷投资者蓄势待发
item.description: 哈维尔-米莱伊总统在立法选举中的强势表现甚至超过了最乐观的预测，缓解了投资者对他对这个危机频发国家的经济改革将停滞不前的担忧，阿根廷资产将因此反弹。【原文：Argentine assets are set to rally as President Javier Milei’s strong showing in legislative elections beat even the most bullish of forecasts, easing investor concern his economic overhaul of the crisis-prone nation would stall.】

item.title: 前中国人民银行顾问离经叛道地呼吁实施 2008 年式大规模刺激计划
item.description: 一位前央行顾问表示，中国应让投资在提振经济方面发挥更大作用，他与其他知名分析师的观点不同，主张大力推进基础设施建设。【原文：China should let investment play a larger role in boosting the economy, a former central bank adviser said, breaking with the views of other prominent analysts by arguing in favor of a big infrastructure construction push.】

item.title: 安瓦尔称特朗普会晤后芯片关税暂时不是问题
item.description: 马来西亚总理安瓦尔-易卜拉欣说，唐纳德-特朗普总统告诉他，美国和马来西亚将 "在适当的时候 "处理美国对半导体征收关税的问题。【原文：Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said President Donald Trump told him the US and Malaysia will deal with US tariffs on semiconductors “at the appropriate time.”】

item.title: 预计日本央行将举行高市就任首相以来的首次会议
item.description: 人们普遍预计，日本央行将在周四举行的首次会议上维持利率不变。【原文：The Bank of Japan is widely expected to hold interest rates on Thursday at its first meeting since Sanae Takaichi, an advocate of easy monetary policy, became prime minister.】
